discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Ref. 5.2.5
Effective incident management often requires a high level of collaboration within and between teams. These teams may include the service desk, technical support, application support, and vendors. Collaboration can facilitate information-sharing and learning, as well as helping to solve the incident more efficiently and effectively.

comments.content: Agree with this answer which is clearly written in the book

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Ref. 5.2.5 - this question is related to time, therfore D is correct
 Every incident should be logged and managed to ensure that it is resolved in a time that meets the expectations of the customer and user. Target resolution times are agreed, documented, and communicated to ensure that expectations are realistic. Incidents are prioritized based on an agreed classification to ensure that incidents with the highest business impact are resolved first.
Option D arguably covers for C

Selected Answer: C
Collaboration between teams helps solve incidents more quickly by leveraging the collective expertise and resources of different groups, leading to faster identification and resolution of the underlying issues.

Selected Answer: D
Detailed procedural will contain the collaboration between teams, in this case answer is D

Selected Answer: C
ITIL says that there aren't usually detailed procedures when resolving incidents and as most of the comments here say, a high level of collaboration is needed. Also listed in the handbook

5.2.5. There should be a formal process for logging and managing incidents. This process
does not usually include detailed procedures for how to diagnose, investigate, and
resolve incidents, but can provide techniques for making investigation and diagnosis
more efficient. There may be scripts for collecting information from users during
initial contact, and this may lead directly to diagnosis and resolution of simple
incidents. ***Investigation of more complicated incidents often requires knowledge
and expertise, rather than procedural steps.***
Answer is c

Selected Answer: C
With over 10 years service desk desk experience. I can say hands down that procedural steps will only help with known issues that cannot be closed. Procedural steps is more of a vague troubleshooting list that will most likely include collaboration. Known issues will need collaboration to solve permanently. As for the majority of time consuming issues, the help desk will need to reach out to specialized teams to resolve them. Collaboration is essential to solve issues quicker.

Selected Answer: D
D all Day! Collaboration is important but having steps is faster.

Selected Answer: C
C Is the correct answer, here is the reference https://killexams.com/demo-download/ITIL-4-FOUNDATION.pdf
correct D
C. It's obvious and clearly stated in the books: "Collaboration can facilitate information-sharing and learning, as well as helping to solve the incident more efficiently and effectively"

Selected Answer: C
Quick incident resolution often requires multiple perspectives, skills, and expertise. Collaboration between different teams, such as technical teams, support teams, and subject matter experts, can help bring together a diverse range of insights and skills to address incidents efficiently. Quick decision-making, sharing of knowledge, and combined efforts to diagnose and address the issue can lead to faster incident resolution. In addition Collaboration align well with the concept of Swarming. Having a detailed Procedure does not necessarily mean quicker resolution time.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Collaboration between teams.

Collaboration between teams is crucial in solving incidents more quickly and effectively. When different teams and individuals work together, they can leverage their collective expertise, share knowledge, and coordinate efforts to diagnose and resolve incidents efficiently. Collaboration promotes communication, collaboration, and knowledge sharing, allowing for faster identification of root causes and the application of appropriate solutions.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

Selected Answer: C
it is C

Selected Answer: D
Je suis pour D car la collaboration c est important pour les incidents complexes. Les procedures pour accroitre la velocité des incidents faible ou moderé.
I agree with D. The question is about time. Full procedure steps will make solving it faster. Collaboration between teams make solving it more efficient and effective. They are playing with words.

The practice that will help solve incidents more quickly is C. Collaboration between teams.

Collaboration between teams allows for a faster and more efficient resolution of incidents. When teams work together, they can share information, expertise, and resources to identify the root cause of the incident and determine the best course of action to resolve it. This collaborative effort can result in a quicker resolution of the incident and can help prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

Target resolution times (A) are useful for setting expectations and prioritizing incidents, but they do not necessarily lead to quicker incident resolution. Escalating all incidents to support teams (B) may overload support teams and slow down incident resolution if not properly prioritized. Detailed procedural steps for incident investigation (D) are important for ensuring that incidents are investigated thoroughly, but they do not necessarily lead to faster incident resolution.

Not all incidents can be covered by a written manual that you need to follow. Case in point an airplane that lost all its engines. Collaboration with all engineers, flight crew, etc. will solve it more quickly than iterating to the textbook line by line. It is C:

Selected Answer: C
swarming

It's not D, because "This process does NOT usually inlcude detailed procedures how to diagnose, investigate, and resolve incidents"

incidente de maneira mais eficiente e eficaz. (este é um trecho do capitulo de gerenciamento de incidentes, o qual todo o capitulo sempre cita a colaboração de toda a equipe sempre deixando isso claro) por tanto resposta correta é a C

questions.question_text: Which will help solve incidents more quickly?

choices.D: Detailed procedural steps for incident investigation
choices.B: Escalating all incidents to support teams

choices.D: To authorize an emergency change via live chat
choices.A: To discuss the cause of an incident via a phone call
choices.C: To request access to a resource via a self-service portal
choices.B: To report a problem using a mobile app

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Users directly communicate to service desk if they encounter a problem. Asking for a service (access to file) is done through service request.

Most users contact the service desk through self-service portals for common requests like access to resources. This method is efficient and widely used for predefined, low-complexity tasks.

A is incorrect because the cause of an incident = problem and the service desk doesn't typically handle problems. B is incorrect because they use the word problem, not incident and the service desk typically doesn't handle a problem. D is incorrect because the service desk doesn't handle emergency changes.

I would go with C, because the questions highlights MOST LIKELY.. I got every month about 3500 of these requests through the self service portal.. how many people report a problem through a mobile app? Most likely it will be a self service portal..

Service desks provide a variety of channels for access. These include:

•phone calls, which can include specialized technology, such as interactive voice response (IVR), conference calls, voice recognition, and others

•service portals and mobile applications, supported by service and request catalogues, and knowledge bases

•chat, through live chat and chatbots
Users directly communicate to service desk if they encounter a problem. Asking for a service (access to file) is done through service request.

questions.question_text: Why and how is a user MOST LIKELY to contact the service desk?
What is used as a tool to help define and measure performance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SLA is obvious

Selected Answer: D
D. A service level agreement

A Service Level Agreement (SLA) is used as a tool to help define and measure performance. An SLA is a formal agreement between a service provider and a customer that outlines the expected level of service, including performance metrics, responsibilities, and agreed-upon service levels. It serves as a crucial document to set expectations, measure performance, and ensure that the services provided meet the agreed-upon standards.

Selected Answer: A
One of the ways organizations are managing their interactions with partners and suppliers is through a framework called SIAM (Service Integration and Management), which involves using an integrator to enact and manage common, coordinated processes across multiple partners and suppliers.

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer: A

Selected Answer: A
3.3 - One method an organization may use to address the partners and suppliers dimension is service integration and management

Selected Answer: A
The dimension that is most concerned with service integration and management is **A. Partners and suppliers**¹. Service Integration and Management is one of the methods organizations can use to address the partners and supplier dimension, which involves the establishment of an integrator who would establish the service relationships for effective communication and collaboration¹. So, the correct answer is **A. Partners and suppliers**.

Selected Answer: A
.correct answer is A

The answer is A. Partners and suppliers.

Service integration and management (SIAM) is a framework for managing multiple suppliers of services. It is concerned with the coordination of the activities of these suppliers to ensure that they work together effectively to deliver the required services. The partners and suppliers dimension of SIAM addresses the following:

The selection and management of suppliers
The definition of service level agreements (SLAs)
The coordination of incident and problem management
The sharing of information and data
The measurement of performance
The other three dimensions of SIAM are:

Organizations and people: This dimension addresses the roles and responsibilities of the different organizations and people involved in SIAM, as well as the culture and behaviors that support effective collaboration.
Value streams and processes: This dimension addresses the identification and optimization of the value streams that deliver the required services.
Information and technology: This dimension addresses the use of information and technology to support SIAM, such as service management tools and platforms.
So the answer is A. Partners and suppliers
correct answer is C

3.3

One method an organization may use to address the partners and suppliers dimension is service integration and management. This involves the use of a specially established integrator to ensure that service relationships are properly coordinated. Service integration and management may be kept within the organization, but can also be delegated to a trusted partner.
